radiographic_examinations.findings: Nodule, 9 cm in diameter, in the left lobe of the thyroid.

radiographic_examinations.date: When the patient was 34 years of age
radiographic_examinations.findings: An oval, homogeneous soft-tissue mass seen in the left side of the neck, at the level of the thyroid cartilage.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Corresponding solid mass, 4.7 cm by 3.4 cm by 4.0 cm, seen on subsequent ultrasound.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Single, prominent focus of iodine uptake diagnostic for tissue of thyroid origin.

radiographic_examinations.date: When the patient was 35.5 years of age
radiographic_examinations.findings: Previous biopsy clips, no other clinically significant findings.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Focused ultrasound of the left breast
radiographic_examinations.date: When the patient was 35.5 years of age
radiographic_examinations.findings: A tubular, predominantly hypoechoic, well-defined structure, 5 mm by 8 mm, with an echogenic, intralesional solid component.
A round, enhancing mass with circumscribed margins in the upper central left breast.
Small hypoechoic region of the left thyroid bed measuring 6 mm, increased from 3 mm 1.5 years earlier.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increase in size from 3 mm to 6 mm.
